column4: did you change your /etc/pulseaudio/daemon.conf, especially the default-sample-channels = 2 line ? it'l have to be set to 6 instead of 2 for a 5.1 system
yes i have done that, and the 5 speakers are working but the subwoofer
i see .... that was my 2 cents contribution i'm afraid, i'd try to rule out subwoofer hardware failure first by hooking it up to another system/OS
it works on windows and because of the upmix: if i unplug the subwoofer cable i can hear the subwoofer, so it lays on pulseaudio
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=795525 might have some helpful insights to try and configure pulseaudio for your exact setup
i just installed pavumeter and cheked if there is any output on the subwoofer: there is no!
is pavucontrol showing the subwoofer channel as muted perhaps ?
but if i look on the alsa-sink arguments there is set subwoofer and not lfe, in alsamixer stands lfe
you might be on to something there i guess, at least worth a try changing that
/etc/pulse/default.pa is the best spot to experiment with different sinks etc. imho
too bad, running out of ideas i'm afraid
but it's funny, if i  have a sound file with true 5.1, so with a subwoofer ouztput channel it works, so it seams that i have to set the upmix for the subwoofer manually on
changed and guess what: it works, so it seems that in the new version lfe remixing is disabled by default
however: thx fo the nice support ;-)
nice that's settled, enjoy the sounds ;)
